meanings.sent1: Dealing with all the complications of planning a surprise party can be overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The complications of solving a difficult puzzle can be frustrating but rewarding.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the complications of a knotted necklace can be quite a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The complications of a spider web can be compared to the intricate details of a mystery novel.
meanings.sent5: Navigating through the complications of a maze requires patience and strategy.

meanings.sent1: Her constant need for complications in the story made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: Adding unnecessary complications to a simple task can make it more difficult.
meanings.sent3: His habit of creating complications out of simple situations always led to chaos.
meanings.sent4: The complications in his explanation only served to confuse the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The complications in her painting process made it hard for her to finish on time.

meanings.definition: A secondary disease or condition aggravating an existing one.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained the possible complications that could arise after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The complications from the flu weakened his immune system further.
meanings.sent3: The complications of a cold on top of a headache made him feel miserable.
meanings.sent4: The complications of an infection can slow down the healing process.
meanings.sent5: The complications of allergies can make everyday tasks more challenging.
